definition: classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
to beat/to hit/variant of 考[kao3]/to inspect/to test/to take an exam
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father

sentences.english: Pakistan and China are all-weather and time-tested friends.
sentences.chinese: 巴基斯坦与中国是久经考验的全天候的伙伴。

sentences.english: His welltested skills as a diplomat may be particularly valuable.
sentences.chinese: 他作为外交官的久经考验的技能可能尤为重要。

sentences.english: The suspension system is derived from a tried and tested Abarth configuration.
sentences.chinese: 悬挂系统是源于一个久经考验阿巴特配置。

sentences.english: There are time-proven techniques to building confidence.
sentences.chinese: 下面就是一些久经考验的建立自信的方法。

sentences.english: This time around, the propulsion system relies on tried-and-true bicycle-style pedals.
sentences.chinese: 而这次，推动系统依靠久经考验的自行车式的踏板。

sentences.english: Miller is a proven play maker and shooter.
sentences.chinese: 米勒是一个久经考验的传球手和射手。

definition: lit. veteran of a hundred battles (idiom)/fig. experienced/seasoned
every voice gives praise (idiom); with an extensive public reputation
experienced person/an old hand at sth
to have perfect mastery of sth/to be up to the mark
only remaining of the great (idiom); one of the few greats extant
a much-travelled person, well acquainted with the ways of the world
genuine goods at fair prices/(fig.) genuine/real/true
to pose as/to flaunt oneself as/to boast of/to brag
